Experiment Config¶

class experiment_config.BaseConfig(**kwargs)[source]¶
DEFAULT_PARAM_VALUES = {}¶
DEPRECATED_PARAMETERS = []¶
GROUPED_PARAMETERS = {}¶
PARAM_TYPES = {}¶
VERSION_INFO = {}¶

The base experiment config class, which should be subclassed to create your own config. The keyword arguments used to initialize your subclass are those methods which you decorate with @parameter.

from experiment_config import BaseConfig, parameter

class MyConfig(BaseConfig):

     # This is always necessary
     def __init__(self, **kwargs):
         super().__init__(**kwargs)

     @parameter()
     def my_parameter(self):
         # Add any initialization/validation code here
         # The @parameter decorator creates a _my_parameter variable.
         return self._my_parameter

 config = MyConfig(my_parameter=2)
copy()[source]¶

Copy this BaseConfig instance.

classmethod from_yaml_file(filepath, **override_kwargs)[source]¶

Loads a config from the specified yaml file. Override the values of any parameters in the yaml file using keyword arguments.

Parameters:filepath (str) – Path to the .yaml file.
group(group_name=None)[source]¶

Get the specified parameter group by name.

Parameters:group_name (str) – (Optional) The group name to get. If None, returns the Default group.
Returns:The group of parameters.
Return type:dict
Raises:ConfigError
parameters()[source]¶

Return the ungrouped parameters.

Return type:dict
classmethod save_default(outpath)[source]¶

Create a new yaml file with default parameter values to the specified outpath. Any parameters without default values will be save with an empty string.

Parameters:outpath (str) – Path to a .yaml file to save.
save_to_yaml(outpath)[source]¶

Save this config in yaml format to the specified path.

Parameters:outpath (str) – Where to save the config.
update(param_name, value)[source]¶

Update the value of a parameter.

Parameters:
  • param_name (str) – The parameter to update.
  • value (Any) – The new value.
validate()[source]¶
Validate all parameters by
  1. Running the code specified in the parameter.
  2. Checking if the types are correct.
  3. Checking if the parameter is deprecated.
Raises:ConfigTypeError, ConfigWarning
exception experiment_config.ConfigError[source]¶

The default Experiment Config Exception

exception experiment_config.ConfigTypeError[source]¶

Exception for when a parameter value type does not match that specified in the @parameter decorator.

exception experiment_config.ConfigVersionWarning[source]¶

Warning for when the current git version does not match the version read from a yaml file by BaseConfig.from_yaml_file().

exception experiment_config.ConfigWarning[source]¶

The default Experiment Config warning.

experiment_config.deprecate()[source]¶

Mark the decorated parameter as deprecated. This will raise a warning when it is accessed.

from experiment_config import BaseConfig, parameter

class MyConfig(BaseConfig):

    def __init__(self, **kwargs):
        super().__init__(**kwargs)

    @deprecate
    @parameter()
    def thing(self):
        # Any additional initialization/validation code here
        return self._thing
experiment_config.parameter(group='Default', default=None, type=None)[source]¶

A decorator for marking a config parameter.

from experiment_config import BaseConfig, parameter

class MyConfig(BaseConfig):

    def __init__(self, **kwargs):
        super().__init__(**kwargs)

    @parameter(group="Group1", type=(str, int), default="hello!")
    def thing(self):
        # Any additional initialization/validation code here
        return self._thing
Parameters:
  • group (str) – (Optional) The parameter group to add this parameter to. If not specified, adds the Default group.
  • default (Any) – (Optional) If specified, sets a default value for this parameter.
  • type (type) – (Optional) Can be a single type or a tuple of types. If specified, restricts the values to these types.
